title: How to Make Your Own Fabric Stuffing

steps.headline: Using scissors, remove thick seams and hems from the fabric.
Cut the remaining fabric into one-inch squares.
Layer a few pieces of fabric together.
Cut horizontally, then vertically.
steps.description: The small pieces are now ready for use as stuffing inside a pillow square, a toy or any other object requiring stuffing. It is also completely washable.

steps.headline: Wash old used panty hose or stockings.
Cut off the elastic waist section.
Fill a pillow square with hose or stocking legs.
steps.description: Stuff in as much as you like until it matches the firmness you're seeking. Then stitch up closure.

steps.headline: Pat it down a little to arrange neatly.

text: Towel and fabric stuffing Gather old towels and fabric.  Using scissors, remove thick seams and hems from the fabric.  Cut the remaining fabric into one-inch squares.  Layer a few pieces of fabric together.  Cut horizontally, then vertically. The small pieces are now ready for use as stuffing inside a pillow square, a toy or any other object requiring stuffing. It is also completely washable. Pantyhose stuffing Wash old used panty hose or stockings.  Cut off the elastic waist section. Discard the waist. Fill a pillow square with hose or stocking legs. Stuff in as much as you like until it matches the firmness you're seeking. Then stitch up closure. Pat it down a little to arrange neatly. Done.
